meanings.sent1: The vine was upcoiling around the trellis.
meanings.sent2: She watched the snake upcoiling itself in the grass.
meanings.sent3: The ribbon seemed to be upcoiling itself into a little spiral dance.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were upcoiling like smoke, drifting aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: The tornado was upcoiling with immense power, swirling everything in its path.

meanings.definition: The act of coiling or twisting upwards.
meanings.sent1: The upcoiling of the rope made it easier to store.
meanings.sent2: The upcoiling of the staircase gave it a unique design.
meanings.sent3: The upcoiling of the slinky toy always fascinated the children.
meanings.sent4: The upcoiling of the hair tie resembled a tiny spring.
meanings.sent5: The upcoiling of the fern's fronds created a beautiful pattern in the garden.
